disclaimer.title: Important Notice
disclaimer.text: This calculator is for educational purposes only. Always use certified dive computers and follow proper dive planning procedures. Never dive beyond your training and certification level.

about.title: About This Calculation
about.description: This dive profile was calculated using the Bühlmann ZHL-16C decompression algorithm with gradient factors {gfLow}/{gfHigh}.

features.safetyStop: Safety stop: 3 minutes at 5 meters (when applicable)
features.tissueCompartments: 16 tissue compartments with nitrogen and helium tracking

about.note: Lower gradient factors (e.g., 30/70) provide more conservative profiles with longer decompression times. Higher gradient factors (e.g., 50/95) are more aggressive with shorter decompression times but higher risk.

footer.madeWith: Made with Bob | Bühlmann ZHL-16C Algorithm Implementation

decompression.title: Decompression Schedule
decompression.noDecoMessage: This dive is within no-decompression limits

exportPdf.missingDiverInfo: Diver information is missing. Do you want to continue without this information?

intro.title: Welcome to the Decompression Calculator
intro.description: This guide will help you understand how to use the application to safely plan your dives. The calculator uses the Bühlmann ZHL-16C algorithm with Gradient Factors to calculate decompression profiles.

step1.title: Access the Calculator
step1.description: From the home page, click the "Start Planning" button to access the decompression calculator.

step2.title: Choose Your Mode
step2.description: Select Simple mode for a single-depth dive, or Advanced mode for multi-level dives with multiple gases.

step3.title: Enter Your Parameters
step3.description: Fill in the required fields (depth, time, gas) and adjust the Gradient Factors according to your desired level of conservatism.

simpleMode.title: Simple Mode
simpleMode.description: Simple mode is ideal for constant-depth dives with a single gas mixture.

depth.title: Depth
depth.description: Enter the maximum depth of your dive (1-100 meters). Use the slider to adjust easily.

bottomTime.title: Bottom Time
bottomTime.description: Time spent at maximum depth in minutes (1-200 minutes).

gasMix.title: Gas Mix
gasMix.description: Choose from predefined mixes (Air, EAN32, EAN36, EAN40) or create a custom mix.

advancedMode.title: Advanced Mode
advancedMode.description: Advanced mode allows you to plan complex dives with multiple depth levels and gas switches.

multiLevel.title: Multi-level Dives
multiLevel.description: Add multiple dive segments at different depths with specific durations.

multiGas.title: Multi-gas
multiGas.description: Configure multiple gas mixes (bottom and decompression) to optimize your dive profile.

rates.title: Custom Rates
rates.description: Adjust descent and ascent rates according to your preferences.

gradientFactors.title: Understanding Gradient Factors
gradientFactors.description: Gradient Factors (GF) control the conservatism level of your decompression profile. They are expressed as GF Low/GF High.

conservative.title: Conservative
conservative.description: Safer profiles with longer decompression times. Recommended for beginner divers, difficult conditions, or after an extended break.

moderate.title: Moderate
moderate.description: Balance between safety and efficiency. Suitable for most experienced divers in normal conditions.

aggressive.title: Aggressive
aggressive.description: Shorter decompression times but increased risk. Reserved for very experienced divers in optimal conditions.

results.title: Understanding Results
results.description: Once the calculation is complete, you will see several important pieces of information:

totalTime.title: Total Dive Time
totalTime.description: Total duration of the dive including descent, bottom time, ascent, and all stops.

decoTime.title: Decompression Time
decoTime.description: Total time spent at decompression stops.

ndl.title: No Decompression Limit (NDL)
ndl.description: Maximum time you can spend at this depth without requiring decompression stops.

decoStops.title: Decompression Stops
decoStops.description: Detailed list of all required stops with their depth, duration, and gas to use.

safety.title: ⚠️ Important Safety Warning
safety.description: This calculator is an educational tool only. It does NOT replace a certified dive computer.
safety.point1: Always use a certified dive computer during actual dives
safety.point2: Never dive beyond your training and certification level
safety.point3: Always consult a qualified professional for technical dive planning
safety.point4: Calculations are provided for informational purposes and do not guarantee dive safety

savedSites.title: Saved Sites
savedSites.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this site?

info.title: Information
info.altitudeEffect: Altitude affects decompression calculations. High-altitude sites require adjustments.
info.waterTempEffect: Water temperature influences air consumption and diver comfort.
info.weatherSource: Weather data provided by Open-Meteo (open-source API)
